intro: Isopogon linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical inflorescences that resemble a bottlebrush. The plant typically grows in heathlands and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its common name. Isopogon linearis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
